Failure to Act/Sexual Assault of Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey F Cano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim T.B.
Lifetime registration required on sex offender registry

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall report no later than 6:00PM on September 16, 2022.  The  first six (6) months to be served without work release, thereafter work release is allowed.

Plea & Sentencing Hearing - September 2, 2022
Plea & Sentencing Hearing - Partial - Judge's Sentence - September 2, 2022

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:23 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Casey F Cano in court.  Attorney Christopher M. Zachar in court for Casey F Cano.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Steiner states plea agreement for the record - Def will plea to Ct. 1 as charged- Sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, with 6 months conditional jail, with conditions as deemed appropriate by DOC
Atty. Zachar agrees with recitation of agreement by Atty. Steiner, states it is a joint recommendation


Court reviews Plea Questionnaire/waiver of rights with defendant
Def. states understanding

Court advises def. that he should be aware that the court is not bound by the plea agreement and gives def. additional time to discuss with his attorney
Atty. Zachar states def. is prepared to proceed to plea/sentencing.

Court advises def. of possible penalties
State is heard - no request for restitution at this time

Def. enters plea of "NO CONTEST" as charged
Def. waives right to PSI, State is not requesting a PSI

Court finds def. has entered his plea freely knowingly and voluntarily - accepts def. plea and finds Def. GUILTY on Ct. 1

Atty Steiner is heard on sentence - requests court approve plea agreement as previously stated
Exh. 1M -  Letter from E.. Zaxby
Exh. 2M -  Email from M. Calhoun

Atty Zachar objects to non-victim statements being considered, Atty Steiner is heard in response

Atty. Steiner recommends if def. is revoked 45 days should be credited then

Court addresses non-victim statements - overrules Atty. Zachar's objection - will consider and give them the weight they deserve
Atty. Zachar renews objection to specific documents for the record

Atty. Zachar is heard on sentence -

Court recesses at 09:58 AM - reconvenes 10:01 AM

Atty Zachar continues with his comments on sentencing - requests court accept the joint recommendation of counsel and order 45 days sentence credit

Defendant is heard on sentence 

Court puts findings on the record - Cannot follow plea agreement -Sentences Def. as follows: 
15 yrs prison, imposed and Stayed -10 yrs initial confinement, followed by 5 yrs. extended supervision
Def. placed on 10 yrs. probation, with the following conditions:  Def. to have no contact with T.B.,  Court costs, counseling and programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, mandatory sex offender reporting. 1 yr in jail as condition of probation, first 6 months without work release, thereafter it is allowed.  45 days credit in event probation is revoked

Atty. Zachar requests stay to report to jail

Court orders Def. to report Crawford County Jail to begin serving his sentence no later than 6 pm. on Sept. 16, 2022

    Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
